alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Inland Glynn; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Glynn, Brantley and southeastern Wayne Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Everett to Fort Mudge. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Nahunta, Hickox, Thalmann, Everett, Raybon, Waynesville, Fort Mudge, Atkinson, Mount Pleasant and Hortense. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
